cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {W} or {U}.)[/i]
This land enters tapped.
When this land enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The sea that stretched out before my eyes is devoid of life... Yes, this sea bears not a single impurity, save one thing: the place where it reflects that blue planet.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {G} or {U}.)[/i]
This land enters tapped.
When this land enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“A large number of kappa inhabit the ravine and have created their own society there. In general, they are very dextrous and excel at making tools. It appears that their technological level is beyond the understanding of human's.”
—Hieda no Akyuu, [/i]The Gensokyo Chronicle[i][/i]
cards.notes:
!tag HM
!tag Spinoff
!tag Chronicle

When you think of waterfalls, there are two images: the powerful, vast waterfall and the meek, trickling one. But this time, I opted for the image of the former... An autumn waterfall. I think the thing waterfalls convey the most is autumn.

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {R} or {W}.)[/i]
This land enters tapped.
When this land enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The dead are naturally able to go there, but it's also possible for living people to visit. This is because throwing away all desires includes freeing oneself of the desire to live, in which case one essentially becomes a living dead.”
—Hieda no Akyuu, [/i]The Gensokyo Chronicle[i][/i]
cards.notes:
!tag SWR
!tag Spinoff
!tag Music
!tag Chronicle

Heaven is really full of enlightened persons of character, but even among them there are inferior ones like her. Still, that gives her an almost human feel. Turning it around, you might say she's an oasis within Heaven.

cards.rules_text:
[i]({T}: Add {U} or {B}.)[/i]
This land enters tapped.
When this land enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]A world that's creepier than anything thus far... Although, when you consider the fact that all those doors are connected to people's backs, I guess you could call it convenient in a way.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Since a human's power can't compare to a youkai's in the first place, it would be impossible to put up a fight within darkness that renders even torchlight useless.”
— Hieda no Akyuu, [/i]The Gensokyo Chronicle[i][/i]

cards.rules_text: Until end of turn, target attacking creature you control can't be blocked except by target untapped creature defending player controls.
cards.flavor_text: [i]To prove their numbers, the monsters lined up across the sea so that the hare could hop across their backs and count them one by one. The hare could not resist boasting of its deception before crossing the last one.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Search your library for a card with a basic land type, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even high-dynamic-range images, and the most Japanesque scenery, are no match for the true color of the sky... Nowadays, perhaps no human exists who believes such an old-fashioned thing.[/i]

cards.notes:
!tag MoF
!tag Music

In the village it's said that the mountain's smoke isn't real smoke, but rather fumes that spew from factories run by the tengu and the kappa... However, the human that lived in the bamboo forest knew.

cards.rules_text:
When this enchantment enters, exile your graveyard.
Commander creatures you control have flying as long as one of the exiled cards has flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, dethrone, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, protection, prowess, reach, trample, vigilance, and ward.

Instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard have flashback {2}{U}. [i](You may cast it from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)[/i]
Creature cards in your graveyard have encore {2}{U}. [i](Exile it and pay its encore cost: For each opponent, create a token copy that attacks that opponent this turn if able. They gain haste. Sacrifice them at the beginning of the next end step. Activate only as a sorcery.)[/i]
[i]The Gensokyo Chronicle[/i] can be your commander.
